text: Sir George Adrian Hayhurst Cadbury (15 April 1929 - 3 September 2015) was a British businessman and rower. He was the Chairman of Cadbury and Cadbury Schweppes for 24 years. He was best known for heading the Committee on the Financial Aspects of Corporate Governance from 1991 to 1995. He also rowed in the Great Britain coxless four in the 1952 Summer Olympics in Helsinki, Finland. Cadbury was born in Birmingham. He was educated at Eton and King's College, Cambridge. Cadbury died on 3 September 2015 in Birmingham, aged 86. ==References== Category:1929 births Category:2015 deaths Category:1952 Summer Olympics Category:Alumni of the University of Cambridge Category:English businesspeople Category:Olympians for Great Britain Category:People educated at Eton College Category:British rowers Category:Sportspeople from Birmingham
title: Adrian Cadbury
